summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Housing and Homelessness Solutions Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on December 10, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers, City Hall. The meeting will be available for public attendance both in-person and via video conference, with live broadcasting on Spectrum Cable Channel 16 and online.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the October 29, 2024, meeting.
2. Briefings on various housing initiatives, including the implementation of the Dallas Housing Policy 2033 and updates on interim housing solutions for unsheltered adults.
3. Discussion on the development of properties for affordable housing, including the Burnett Lofts and Paradise Gardens.

**Important Details**:  
- The committee will review action plans for the Dallas Housing Policy 2033, presented by the Department of Housing & Community Development.
- An update on the Office of Homeless Solutions will cover upcoming requests for information regarding interim housing services.
- The Fiscal Year 2024-25 Annual Urban Land Bank Demonstration Program Plan will be discussed, including a public comment period and adoption timeline.

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks approval for several key actions, including:
- Authorizing the Dallas Public Facility Corporation to acquire and develop the Burnett Lofts.
- Approving a public hearing for the Paradise Gardens project and authorizing the Dallas City Council to act as the elected representative for issuing multifamily residential mortgage revenue bonds.

The meeting will also include provisions for an executive session if necessary.
